Buena opci√≥n para probar comida ecuatoriana, pero con algunos detalles por...

Visitamos El Guayaquile√±o en familia (mi esposa, mi hija y yo) buscando probar algo de nuestra querida comida ecuatoriana. El lugar est√° bien ubicado, lo cual es conveniente.
Comenzamos con unas empanadas de verde rellenas de queso que estuvieron muy ricas.
Ten√≠an bastante queso y no estaban grasosas, lo cual fue un buen inicio.
Mi esposa pidi√≥ un pescado frito apanado con arroz y menestra. Lamentablemente, al pescado le falt√≥ sabor y la apanadura no estaba tan rica como esper√°bamos. Por otro lado, yo ped√≠ un caldo de bolas que s√≠ estuvo delicioso, muy bien preparado y con buen sabor.
La atenci√≥n fue r√°pida, aunque notamos que los meseros estaban un poco despistados. A pesar de eso, fueron amables. El men√∫ es variado y tienen bastantes opciones para quienes buscan algo t√≠pico de Ecuador.
En general, la comida no est√° mal si se quiere disfrutar de algo de nuestro pa√≠s, pero creo que podr√≠an mejorar algunos platos para que la experiencia sea a√∫n mejor.

Excellent and fresh Ecuadorian food, we always order lunch special, they have a variety of dishes and all tasty, most of the dishes are coast side of the county style. Cold oatmeal Ecuadorian style is delicious and very recommended. We always go back.

This place was terrible. Overpriced and food was not fresh. I ordered Caldo de Salchicha and it was salty it didn‚Äôt have cilantro it had scallions!! They also served it with rice? This caldo is not served with a side of rice. They did not give me limes either. I told the waitress and she said the cook tasted it and it wasn‚Äôt! Didn‚Äôt even offer an apology or an option to change my dish. This caldo also had a pigs feet in it‚Ä¶?!! The quaker wasn‚Äôt a Quaker it was too watery. The food presentation was awful I ordered a carne asada with plantains. The one piece of meat was in a plate 4 tostones in a bowl. In other restaurants all meats come with a salad. And the waitress was sweeping right next to our table lifting the dust up‚Ä¶. Just terrible the food was not authentic what a disappointment. I was really looking forward to eating at this place. I came from far ‚Ä¶ don‚Äôt go to this place! Oh and on top of that they wanted $ 18.00 - $25.00 tip!!! lol the nerves‚Ä¶

Omg!!! I freaking love this restaurant! My mothers side is from Guayaquil & I always loved her & my grandmothers food until I came here. Their service is great! So far their dishes are almost better than my grandmothers cooking and that‚Äôs a lot coming from someone who only use to eat homemade Ecuadorian food. I can‚Äôt wait to try all of their dishes! I came on a Sat. night for the first time and it was so good I came back on a Monday night lol!

The purpose of this review is not to hate or harm this restaurant in any way, shape, or form. That being said, I hope you take this review as an informative review.

Atmosphere: The restaurant's exterior and interior are well organized. Clean for the most part. However, the music they have there makes it feel like you're not in a restaurant but in a nightclub.

Service: Honestly, service was okay. I went there because my cousin invited me. I did not feel like the waitress went beyond to make us feel at home. In other words, it was an average service.

Food: I ordered the Guatita, and my cousin ordered the Encebollado De Pescado. They tasted okay, neither bad nor good. I felt like something was missing, probably a little more flavor.

Price: It could just be my personal point of view. Considering the factors mentioned above, I think their prices are kind of high. You can go ahead and experience it yourself. You may have a different point of view.

My first time there (I go to my mom if I want ecuadorian dishes). I was truly satisfied with the combo guayaquile√±o dish. The bolon had the perfect amount of chicharron while the beef, it's sauce and the two sunny sides gave it the expected flavors of that dish. Had the quaker. Wow! Never had it w the maracuya. Delicious. The morocho was also great. There were 8 of us there and we were all completely satisfied! Staff were great too. Friendly and always checked in on us. Definitely will go again soon!

Coming from an Ecuadorian, this food is very good. Their grilled steak is very tasty. It even has grill marks on it. No complaints. If the prices were a little cheaper it would be even better. It is well worth the price!

We discover this restaurant on google search after picking up a friend from Ecuador that haven't eaten ecuadorian food in a long time, so we brought him here straight from the airport. We ordered the encebollado, caldo de salchicha, seco de chivo and guatita. The encebollado and caldo de salchicha were excellent, the guatita was ok, and the seco de chivo was so so. Overall good food, but I won't be ordering seco de chivo again.  Fyi, Caldo de salchicha is only available on weekends.

Only reason I‚Äôm putting one star is because both of the waiters that were serving my brothers and I were very rude and in a way were rushing us to decide what we want and to leave quickly.
Since that‚Äôs what we felt we decided to make the food to go. We ordered 2 encebollados 2 chaulfanes and a ceviche de camar√≥n. Come to find out the encebollados don‚Äôt come with chifles? If you‚Äôre a real Ecuadorean you know that every encebollado comes with chifles.
For the price that we paid we atleast expected that. Food wasn‚Äôt bad but wasn‚Äôt the best either. We came from out of state in hopes of eating something that reminded us from home but it wasn‚Äôt at we expected. would definitely not come back again. I‚Äôm only saying this so people don‚Äôt make the same mistake as us.

Good Ecuadorian food and a nice service. However, don't expect the food to have the same flavor kilometers away from home. The place is nice and cozy, it could be good for groups. They have a nice lunch special for less than 10 dollars in which you can get soup and second dish.
